name: Privacy Rule
description: National standards to protect patient health information privacy. Controls use and disclosure of PHI, grants individual rights, and establishes workforce requirements.

name: Right to Access
description: Individuals have the right to access, inspect, and obtain copies of their PHI maintained by covered entities. Access must be provided within 30 days of request.

name: Right to Request Amendment
description: Individuals can request amendment of their PHI if they believe it is inaccurate or incomplete. Amendments must be processed within 60 days.

name: Right to Accounting of Disclosures
description: Individuals have the right to receive an accounting of disclosures of their PHI made by covered entities. Accounting must be provided within 60 days.

name: Right to Request Restrictions
description: Individuals can request restrictions on uses and disclosures of their PHI. Covered entities may accept or decline restrictions.

name: Right to Request Confidential Communications
description: Individuals may request that covered entities communicate with them at an alternative address or by an alternative method for privacy reasons.

name: Treatment
description: Use or disclosure of PHI for direct healthcare delivery to the individual. Providers may use PHI to treat patients without explicit authorization.

name: Payment
description: Use or disclosure of PHI for healthcare billing, claims processing, and insurance-related activities. Can be used without authorization.

name: Healthcare Operations
description: Use or disclosure of PHI for administrative, quality improvement, compliance, and other healthcare operations. No explicit authorization required.

name: Privacy Notice Requirement
description: Covered entities must provide written notice to individuals describing privacy practices, individual rights, and organizational contact information at first service encounter.

name: Minimum Necessary Standard
description: When using or disclosing PHI, covered entities must limit uses, disclosures, and requests to the minimum amount of information necessary to accomplish the intended purpose.

name: Authorization Requirements
description: Covered entities must obtain written authorization from individuals before using or disclosing PHI for purposes other than treatment, payment, or healthcare operations.

name: Administrative Safeguards
description: Policies, procedures, and processes to prevent unauthorized access, use, and disclosure of PHI. Includes access controls, audit procedures, and workforce training.

name: Physical Safeguards
description: Physical measures to protect facilities, buildings, and equipment from unauthorized access and environmental threats that could affect PHI.

name: Workforce Privacy Training
description: Covered entities must provide privacy training to workforce members who have access to PHI. Training must address privacy policies and procedures.

name: OCR Enforcement
description: U.S. Department of Health and Human Services Office for Civil Rights (OCR) enforces the Privacy Rule through investigation and civil penalties for violations.
